clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Study of the Airway to Predict Endotracheal Tube Size in Anesthetized Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Study of the Airway to Predict Endotracheal Tube Size in Anesthetized Pediatric Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether ultrasound study of the airway to predict endotracheal tube size in anesthetized pediatric patients better than the tube size formula

detailed_description.textblock: This study is to compare the methods of selecting uncuffed endotracheal tube size in pediatric patients between conventional age-based formula and ultrasound measurement of subglottic diameter.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Sealed envelops were used. Ultrasonographers were masked with the group of patients. Participants were masked with the techniques of selecting endotracheal tubes. Care providers and outcome assessors were masked with the techniques of selecting. endotracheal tubes

primary_outcome.description: Clinically fit of endotracheal tube with leak at 20-25 cmH2O

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of subglottic diameter and proper size endotracheal tube
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of subglottic diameter measured by ultrasound and proper size endotracheal tube determined by clinically fit.

clinical_study.condition: Pediatric General Anesthesia With Endotracheal Tube

arm_group.description: Using ultrasound measurement of the subglottic area to choose endotracheal tube size
Using Cole's formula to choose endotracheal tube size

intervention.description: Using ultrasound to determine the size of endotracheal tube

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 1-6 Years
- ASA class 1-2
- Elective Surgery
- GA with oral uncuff endotracheal tube
Exclusion Criteria:
- Potential difficult air way from history and physical exam
- Allergy ti ultrasound gel
- neck mass
- unstable vital sign

reference.citation: Shibasaki M, Nakajima Y, Ishii S, Shimizu F, Shime N, Sessler DI. Prediction of pediatric endotracheal tube size by ultrasonography. Anesthesiology. 2010 Oct;113(4):819-24. doi: 10.1097/ALN.0b013e3181ef6757.
